turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Roaring Fork (Great Smoky Mountains).
turn.2: The Reagan mill is a standard tub mill, with a flume redirecting water from Roaring Fork to power a tub-wheel turbine.
turn.3: What was the purpose of the mill?
turn.4: The turbine turns a grindstone which breaks down corn and wheat into cornmeal and flour.
turn.6: Reagan's mill was well-designed and well-positioned.
turn.7: What is the most interesting fact about the mill?
turn.8: It is said that when other mills lacked sufficient water power due to low water levels, Reagan's mill would continue to operate.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The Alex Cole Cabin is the last surviving structure from the Sugarlands community proper.
turn.12: Built by mountain guide Albert Alexander Cole, it has been moved from its original site to the Jim Bales Place along the Roaring Fork Motor Nature Trail.
